transparency_law.name: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act

response_requirements.initial_response_description: Custodian must respond within 5 business days by furnishing copies, advising time/place for inspection, or denying in writing with specific reasons
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Records must be furnished promptly after response

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Public body may NOT charge search or retrieval fee
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: May charge reasonable fees for reproduction not to exceed actual cost

exemptions.description: Public employee personnel files (salary, benefits, job classification remain public)
Investigation records may be exempt while investigation active; final disposition records generally public
Communications protected by attorney-client privilege; legal advice to public bodies
Proprietary business information if competitive harm demonstrated
Various exemptions found throughout West Virginia Code

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Person denied access may petition circuit court for writ of mandamus; proceeding given priority on court calendar
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and costs to substantially prevailing petitioner
appeal_process.civil_penalties_notes: Willful violation may result in removal from office
appeal_process.criminal_penalties_notes: Criminal penalties for willful destruction of records

requester_requirements.request_format_notes: May be oral or written (written recommended); must state with reasonable specificity the information sought
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request directly to custodian with reasonable specificity

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Elected or appointed official charged with responsibility of keeping and maintaining public records
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Custodian must furnish proper and reasonable opportunities for inspection
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Provisions shall be liberally construed with view of carrying out public policy declaration
agency_obligations.foia_registry_notes: Must report all FOIA requests to Secretary of State for public database (since 2016)

oversight_body.name: Secretary of State - FOIA Database
oversight_body.role: Maintains publicly accessible database of all FOIA requests and responses

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official West Virginia statute. 5 business day response required. Search fees PROHIBITED. Only actual reproduction costs allowed. Circuit court enforcement with priority calendar placement. Attorney fees to substantially prevailing petitioner. Willful violations may result in removal from office. UNIQUE: All FOIA requests reported to Secretary of State for public database since 2016. Liberal construction required.
